toolSpec.name: python
toolSpec.description: Run a Python script. Use this for all math and date/time computations, to generate charts, diagrams, or QR codes, to test Python code, and to get its printed output. You can only see the result if it is printed. Don't use it to run code that I pass to you. You can use these and only these additional modules: <modules>numpy, pandas, mpmath, numba, tabulate, matplotlib, networkx, yfinance, qrcode, scikit-learn, umap-learn</modules> You cannot install other modules. You can only save files (temporarily) in /tmp. Add tests and checks to the code to be sure that results are correct. To show images, charts, or diagrams written to /tmp, add a line per image to the script output using this exact format: Show image '<path/filename>'

script.description: The Python script to run. It can run for up to 30 seconds. Keep it simple. Keep the running time as low as possible. It's better to run multiple small scripts thaty one that requires more time. Keep the code simple and short and avoid using complex libraries. Don't repeat code and don't repeat yourself (DRY). To show images, charts, or plots written to /tmp, add a line per image to the script output using this exact syntax: Show image '<path/filename>'

number_of_images.description: The number of images expected in output from this script. If the number of shown images in the script is different from this number, an error is raised.

toolSpec.name: duckduckgo_text_search
toolSpec.description: Use DuckDuckGo text WWW search engine. Browse the URL links in the response for detailed information.

keywords.description: The search terms to look for.

toolSpec.name: duckduckgo_news_search
toolSpec.description: DuckDuckGo news search engine. Use this to find what happened recently. Always browse the URL links in the response for more information.

keywords.description: The search terms to look for.

toolSpec.name: duckduckgo_maps_search
toolSpec.description: DuckDuckGo maps search engine. Use this to search for things near a place. Always browse the URL links in the response for more information.

keywords.description: The search terms to look for.

place.description: The place where to look for.

toolSpec.name: wikipedia_search
toolSpec.description: Search Wikipedia for pages relete to your query. Returns a list of Wikipedia page titles. Use this tool for Wikipedia content.

query.description: The query to use to look for relevant Wikipedia pages.

toolSpec.name: wikipedia_geodata_search
toolSpec.description: Search Wikipedia by location. Use this to search for articles related to a location. Returns a list of Wikipedia page titles.

latitude.description: The latitude for the geo search.

longitude.description: The longitude for the geo search.

title.description: The title of the Wikipedia page to get.

radius.description: Search radius in meters. The value must be between 10 and 10000.

toolSpec.name: wikipedia_page
toolSpec.description: Get a Wikipedia page by title. This is the preferred tool to get the full content of a Wikipedia page. The page content is stored in the archive. Pass keywords to retrieve specific information from the archive. Use links in the page to browse other pages or other web sites and get more information.

title.description: The title of the Wikipedia page to get.

keywords.description: The keywords to retrieve information for this page. Keywords should be specific to the content and topic you want to retrieve. Avoid generic terms like 'latest news' or 'general information'.

toolSpec.name: browser
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to browse and read carefully a web page on the internet. You can then browse the URL links in the response for more information. The web site content is stored in the archive so that you can retieve the information you need. Pass keywords to retrieve specific information from the archive. Use links in the page to browse other pages or other web sites and get more information.

url.description: The HTTP(S) URL to browse. Use https://... when possible.

keywords.description: The keywords to retrieve information for this page. Keywords should be specific to the content and topic you want to retrieve. Avoid generic terms like 'latest news' or 'general information'.

toolSpec.name: retrive_from_archive
toolSpec.description: This is your personal archive from which you can retrieve information by keywords. To use this tool correctly, make more than one requests with different keywords (for example, one per URL or per page) instead of a single large request. It can return Markdown or HTML, including links that you can browse with other tools. If you don't find the info you need, you can browse or search the internet or use wikipedia to get more info.

keywords.description: The keywords to retrieve information from the archive. Keywords should be specific to the content and topic you want to retrieve. Avoid generic terms like 'latest news' or 'general information'.

toolSpec.name: store_in_archive
toolSpec.description: This is your personal archive. You can use this tool to store text, Markdown, or HTML content that you can later retrieve by keywords.

content.description: The text, Markdown, or HTML content to store in the archive.

toolSpec.name: sketchbook
toolSpec.description: Use this sketchbook to write, review, and update text content. Content is stored in sections that you can add, review, update, or delete sequentially, one at a time. Separate topics in different sections. When you start a new sketchbook, the previous one is deleted. You can add a section at the end, ask for info (the number of sections, words, and characters in the sketchbook), start a review, update the current section, or delete the current section. Use this tool to write content like articles, blog posts, essays, books, or just to take notes will working on your answer. When you're ok with the content of the sketchbook, save it for me. I cannot see the sketchbook before you save it and then share it.

command.description: How to use the sketchbook, can be 'start_new', 'add_section_at_the_end', 'info', 'start_review', 'next_section', 'update_current_section', 'delete_current_section', or 'save_sketchbook_file'.

content.description: The content to update the latest read section or to add a new section at the end. Use Markdown to format content. Don't add triple dots (...) or comments like 'to be continued' between sections. Each section can contain thousands of words. You can only include images that are stored in the image archive. To include an image in the sketchbook, add a line with the format '[image_id: <image_id>]' where <image_id> is the exact image_id of an image stored in the image catalog. Check that the image_id is valid by searching for it in the image catalog. If you need a new image, you can search and download it, generate it, or use Python to render a chart or a diagram.

toolSpec.name: checklist
toolSpec.description: Use this checklist to track your progress and ensure you have covered all important points. You can add an item as next (to do it immediately) or at the end, show the current items, or mark the next to-do item as completed in the checklist. Use this tool to track your progress and ensure you have covered all important points.

command.description: How to use the checklist, can be 'start_new', 'add_item_as_next', 'add_item_at_the_end', 'show_items', 'mark_next_to_do_item_as_completed'.

content.description: The content for a new checklist item.

toolSpec.name: generate_image
toolSpec.description: With this tool, you can generate/create a new image based on a text-to-image prompt. Do not use this tool when asked to show, search, or find an image. Generate an image only if I explicitly asks to generate, create, or draw an image. The output image is stored in the image catalog and is shown to me.

toolSpec.name: search_image_catalog
toolSpec.description: Find images in the image catalog by description.

description.description: The image description to search for.

toolSpec.name: similarity_image_catalog
toolSpec.description: Search for images similar to a reference image you provide. Use this tool when asked for a similar image. Trust the result of this tool even if the description seems to be not what you expect.

image_id.description: The 'image_id' of the reference image for which you search for similarity.

toolSpec.name: random_images
toolSpec.description: Get random images from the image catalog.

num.description: The number of random images to get.

toolSpec.name: get_image_by_id
toolSpec.description: Get info on an image by its 'image_id'. This tool can also be used to check that an image_id is valid and exists in the image catalog.

image_id.description: The 'image_id' of the image to get.

toolSpec.name: image_catalog_count
toolSpec.description: Get the number (count) of images in the image catalog.

toolSpec.name: download_image_into_catalog
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to download images from a URL into the image catalog. You can only download freely available images. You can find the link/URL browsing or searching the internet. Wikipedia pages often contain images that you can download.

url.description: The public URL link to download the image from.

toolSpec.name: personal_improvement
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to track suggestions and mistake and to find ways to improve for the future. Collect suggestions or find pratical improvements that will be added to your system prompt. Improvements should be generic and not specific to a single question.

mistake.description: A description of a mistake you just made (optional).

improvements.description: A full long paragraph describing all the improvements. These improvements are added to your system prompt to avoid making the same mistakes again. The value of this field replaces all previous improvements.

toolSpec.name: arxiv
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to search and automatically download scientific research articles from arXiv. This is the preferred way to download academic papers. The articles found by this tool are stored in the archive, and you must then retrieve the information you need from the archive.

query.description: The query used to look for and automatically download scientific papers on arXiv.

max_results.description: The maximum number of results from the query.

toolSpec.name: save_file
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to save a text file in output.

filename.description: The output filename with no path.

content.description: The text content of the file.

toolSpec.name: conversation
toolSpec.description: Use this tool to transform content into an entertaining professional conversation between three friendly peers: Ruth (US English), Matthew (US English), and Amy (UK English). Never mention their names in the conversation. The conversation is explaining content in detail by asking and answering questions. Jump straight to the first topic without introductions. Cover all topics in order. The output is written to two files: a text and an audio file.

conversation.description: The final script of the conversation between Ruth (US English), Matthew (US English), and Amy (UK English). Never mention their names in the script lines. Use this JSON format: [ { "name": "...", "line": "..." }, ... ]
